thread.title: Air Force: French train hero stabbed in California
thread.title_full: Air Force: French train hero stabbed in California - US News

author: USNews
title: Air Force: French train hero stabbed in California
text:
Air Force: airman who was hero on Paris train was stabbed in California; in stable condition FILE - In this Sept. 17, 2015 file photo, President Barack Obama speaks to Air Force Airman 1st Class Spencer Stone in the Oval Office of the White House in Washington. An Air Force spokesman says Stone, who helped subdue an attacker on a French train in August, is in stable condition after being stabbed in California. (AP Photo/Andrew Harnik, File)
Associated Press Oct. 8, 2015 | 11:50 a.m. EDT + More The Associated Press
WASHINGTON (AP) â€” An Air Force spokesman says Airman 1st Class Spencer Stone, who helped subdue an attacker on a French train in August, is in stable condition after being stabbed in California.
The spokesman, Lt. Col. Christopher Karns, said details are sketchy. He said Stone is being treated in a hospital in the Sacramento area.
Stone is assigned to Travis Air Force Base in California.
Karns said the matter is being handled by local law enforcement officials. Karns had no details on the nature or exact location of the stabbing.
